page.title: 13Social Concerns in Yewdale
page.content: Increasing mechanisation, and the amalgamation of fell farms led to a decline in the number of workers needed on the land, and this in turn led to{rural depopulation.}This problem is not as acute in this area as it is in other remote parts of the country, because of the stabilising effect of alternative sources of income, e.g. tourism. Nevertheless, many of the fell farms are lonely, and farmers' wives sometimes have a particular sense of{isolation. In addition, not all of a farmer's children will be able to, or indeed want to, continue with the farm, and many young people must leave the area to find employment. Those that stay find the cost of local housing very high, because of the pressure on prices from buyers outside the area looking for{holiday homes.
